title: Probe into Randox Manchester 'manipulated' drug tests - BBC News
text:
Probe into Randox Manchester 'manipulated' drug tests 19 February 2017 Close share panel Image copyright Thinkstock Image caption The firm has provided each police force affected with a list of cases that may have been affected Test results may have been "manipulated" at a laboratory used by police to analyse drug samples, it has emerged. 
Two employees of Randox Testing Services (RTS) have been arrested as part of a criminal inquiry, Greater Manchester Police said. 
The allegations, first reported by the Mirror , relate to drug tests analysed at its Manchester office. 
RTS said it was fully co-operating with the investigation. 
The company, based in Northern Ireland, is used by police forces across the UK to analyse samples used in prosecutions. 
Two men, aged 47 and 31, have been arrested on suspicion of perverting the course of justice and bailed. 'No question mark' 
The firm has provided each force affected with a list of cases that may have been affected, and said some tests could be "re-run". 
In a statement, it said there was no evidence to say alcohol samples had been affected and the investigation centres on the "manipulation of quality control data, which supports test results". 
"A number of toxicology results have been compromised. RTS are working tirelessly to fully assess the impact and implications for each case. Where possible, when viable, samples will be re-run to provide robust, uncompromised results. 
"There is no question mark over the RTS quality system or the robustness of our practices and procedures." 
Chief Constable Debbie Simpson, the National Police Chiefs' Council lead for forensic science, said Randox had provided each force with a list of cases that could have been effected. 
"Working in partnership with the Crown Prosecution Service, we have provided guidance to forces so they are able to review each case to determine if compromised data played a part in prosecution and the CPS will then take appropriate action in any cases identified," she added.
